pr_title: bugfix:fix wrong proxy of datasource bean

timeline.bodyText: In JDK Proxy case, what invocationHandler has a field of type DataSourceProxy?
timeline.author: ggndnn

replies.bodyText: When datasource bean has been proxied once.
replies.author: xingfudeshi

timeline.author: ggndnn
slievrly
slievrly

timeline.message: Merge branch 'fix_duplicate_proxy' of https://github.com/xingfudeshi/seata into fix_duplicate_proxy
using spring to create automatic proxy
using spring to create automatic proxy

timeline.bodyText: Do we need a include attribute?
timeline.author: ggndnn
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -38,4 +38,10 @@
      * @return useJdkProxy
      */
     boolean useJdkProxy() default false;
+
+    /**
+     * Specifies which datasource bean are not eligible for auto-proxying
+     * @return
+     */
+    String[] exclude() default {};

replies.bodyText: I don't think we need the include attribute, and exclude is only to avoid unnecessary proxy. In fact, even if the proxy, it won't have any impact.
replies.author: xingfudeshi

replies.bodyText:
It makes sense. But I think include is an effective feature helping users to control auto proxying, avoiding unexpected situations, there is no harm to provide such a function.
By the way, should exclude be excludes? Because the attribute is array type.
replies.author: ggndnn

timeline.author: ggndnn

timeline.message: use Spring AOP to create auto-proxy

replies.bodyText: Yes, but sometimes it means gerund.Need to change to proxy?

timeline.bodyText: Do we need to throw exception or log warning message when m == null?
timeline.author: ggndnn

replies.bodyText: When m=null,the method of original bean should be called.
